title: How is it possible that the 2000s is almost 20 years ago? It feels like yesterday. - Quora

response.answer_text: Time is relative. Always. Forever. Every night while we sleep the hours go by quickly. Dreams alter our sense of time either by compressing it or expanding it. We’ve all awakened and over slept as time went by and we were oblivious. We have all been busy doing something only to say, at some point, “WHERE did the time go???!” If you watch the seconds of your life go by, tick——tick——tick, time will slow down. I am from the 40’s and if YOU think YOUR time has gone by fast, then mine has passed even exponentially faster than from 2000 until 2020! Einstein’s discussions on time explain this. Your point in observing time depends on whether you are sitting walking running flying etc. Observer (special relativity) - Wikipedia Original Question: How is it possible that the 2000s is almost 20 years ago? It feels like yesterday.

I guess the only real explanation is that you don’t keep a daily journal. If you did you would be able to see where all of that time went. Otherwise, the earth still spins about 24 hours in a day. The earth still orbits about 365 days a year. It gets light and dark and light and dark and you have no documentation. (By the way, compare your health and agility between now and then - it will make it a lot easier to believe that the time has really passed.)

Perhapse this psychological effect is due to the high “information-density per time”, which grew exponentially since the advent of social media. I don't believe the human brain is designed to function properly with such a daily avalanche of news feeds & posts. It ought to mess up many things, least of which is our sense of time-sync & metrics chronology.

Thanks for A2A. If 2000s is considered from 2000 to 2009, then it is only 10 years. But let us consider the question considering year 2000, then yes. But you have changed 19 calendars and 20th is waiting. TIME IS IN FACT RELATIVE, AS ALLUDED TO BY TOM. Time perception varies from person to person and for a person from time to time. You might not have felt that for previous 20 years in same manner. As we age, we feel time going relatively faster. When you are enjoying life, time is shooting past. When it is boring, time appears to slow down. You are lucky that you had happy 2000s, but was that so fast?
